question.questionA: Corolla with four nearly equal lobes, or with one lower lip.
question.questionB: Corolla distinctly two-lipped.

question.questionA: Corolla with four nearly equal lobes.
question.questionB: Corolla with one lower lip, the upper lip very short or absent.

question.questionA: Inflorescence terminated by a cluster of leaves.
question.questionB: Inflorescence terminated by flowers.

question.questionA: Terminal inflorescence globular or ovoid, little longer than broad.
question.questionB: Terminal inflorescence a spike, much longer than broad.

question.questionA: Plants smelling of apples; leaves rugose; flowers pale pink or lilac.
question.questionB: Plants smelling of peppermint; leaves not rugose; flowers deep pink or lilac.

question.questionA: Lower lip of three unequal lobes; corolla tube hairy within.
question.questionB: Lower lip of five unequal lobes; corolla tube hairless within.

question.questionA: Tufted  perennials;  leaves  simple,  wooly-hai red; flowers yellow or purple.
question.questionB: Annuals; leaves trifid with linear lobes; flowers yellow.

question.questionA: Annuals; lower leaves pinnatifid.
question.questionB: Perennial herbs or shrubs.

question.questionA: Perennial herbs, smelling of garlic when crushed.
question.questionB: Shrubs.

question.questionA: Dwarf  shrub; stems ending in spines; leaves c. 2mm, triangular, margins revolute; leaves and flowers below the spines.
question.questionB: Stems not ending in spines; leaves more than 2 mm.

question.questionA: Flowers axillary, solitary; plants foetid; leaves linear.
question.questionB: Flowers in groups of two or more.

question.questionA: Flowers axillary, forming one-sided terminal spikes.
question.questionB: Flowers in terminal capitate clusters.

question.questionA: Flowers greenish yellow.
question.questionB: Flowers lilac or purple.

question.questionA: Leaves ovate, entire, c. 1 cm, margin revolute, green above, white with adpressed hairs below; flowers in whorls of two to four.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate, crenulate, 1-3 cm, margin not revolute, dark green above, light green below; flowers in whorls of two to six.

question.questionA: Plants greyish with branched hairs; leaves spathulate, slightly crenulate towards the tip.
question.questionB: Plants wool ly-haired; leaves ovate-lanceolate, crenulate along both sides.

question.questionA: Stems ending in a single compact inflorescence.
question.questionB: Stems ending in a group of compact inflorescences.

question.questionA: Stamens two.
question.questionB: Stamens four.

question.questionA: Leaves linear, margins revolute.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate-lanceolate, flat.

question.questionA: Stamens and style not longer than corolla tube.
question.questionB: Stamens and style distinctly longer than corolla tube.

question.questionA: Flowers blue or violet, in a dense spike.
question.questionB: Flowers white or yellow.

question.questionA: Bracteoles absent; calyx lobes five, spine-tipped.
question.questionB: Bracteoles present; calyx lobes five to ten, not spine-tipped.

question.questionA: Upper lip of corolla distinctly arched over stamens.
question.questionB: Upper lip of corolla more or less flat.

question.questionA: Calyx c. 25 mm long, campanulate, obliquely two-lipped, teeth spiny.
question.questionB: Calyx much less than 25 mm long.

question.questionA: Calyx two-lipped, or of five lobes separated into two lips.
question.questionB: Calyx with five more or less equal lobes, not forming two lips.

question.questionA: Lips of calyx closed after flowering.
question.questionB: Lips of calyx not closed after flowering.

question.questionA: Calyx with a boss or ridge on the back; calyx lobes blunt.
question.questionB: Calyx without a boss or ridge; calyx lobes acute.

question.questionA: Carpels flat-topped, as if cut off.
question.questionB: Carpels rounded at the top.

question.questionA: Corolla tube shorter than calyx; flowers at least 20 mm long.
question.questionB: Corolla tube at least as long as calyx; flowers 10-15 mm long.

question.questionA: Calyx conical, conspicuously ten-veined.
question.questionB: Calyx cylindrical or campanulate, usually with five veins.

question.questionA: Flowers yellow.
question.questionB: Flowers pink.

question.questionA: Annuals;  leaves broadly ovate, yellowish green;  flowers pale pink, lower lip of corolla with red spots.
question.questionB: Perennials; leaves lanceolate, dark green; flowers pink or white, lower lip of corolla unspotted.

question.questionA: Calyx with five lobes, separated into two lips.
question.questionB: Calyx with five more or less regular lobes or calyx entire.

question.questionA: Calyx oval, strongly laterally compressed, thirteen-veined.
question.questionB: Calyx cylindrical or campanulate, ten-veined.

question.questionA: Calyx ten-veined.
question.questionB: Calyx thirteen- to fifteen-veined.

question.questionA: Hairs in throat of corolla included; calyx teeth with long cilia; peduncles short or absent; leaves on main axis 2-4 cm.
question.questionB: Hairs in throat of calyx exserted after flowering; calyx teeth shortly and sparsely ciliate; leaves on main axis 1-2 cm.

question.questionA: Leaves up to 10 mm, ovate, lower leaves rounded at the base, upper leaves linear; calyx with long, dense spreading hairs.
question.questionB: Leaves c. 5 mm; calyx glabrous.

question.questionA: Lower leaves cordate; flowers white.
question.questionB: Lower leaves rounded at the base or cuneate; flowers lilac.
